headline.main: In Breast Cancer Data, Hope, Fear and Confusion

docs.abstract: Researchers say that most American overestimate their risk of getting breast cancer the odds that disease will be fatal; say few women feel anywhere near the same dread of heart disease, even though it kills far more women, and few realize that lung cancer surpassed breast cancer 10 years ago as leading cause of death from cancer in women; tables show risk factors for breast cancer, noting risk at various age levels; graph compares death rates for cardiovascular disease, breast and lung cancer; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: When they are asked to identify the greatest threat to their health, most American women name breast cancer. Most of them are wrong. Women overestimate their risk of getting breast cancer, researchers say, and they also overestimate the odds that the disease will be fatal. Few feel anywhere near the same dread of heart disease, even though it kills far more women, and few realize that lung cancer surpassed breast cancer 10 years ago as the leading cause of death from cancer in women.

headline.main: Now Is the Time For a Tax Cut; Litigate to Legislate

docs.abstract: Letter from Anne Fennell, prompted by Pres Clinton's plan to sue tobacco companies to recover health care costs, says she is terrified by new Government policy of taxation by litigation (S)
